abstract: Anthony Hill, black Air Force veteran who was shot and killed by white police officer in Chamblee, Ga, tried to follow his grandfather's advice to 'be sensible' in life; state investigation of shooting is under way; friends and family say his bizarre behavior before shooting was symptom of his bipolar disorder.
lead_paragraph: Long before two bullets from an officer’s gun tore through Anthony Hill’s chest, he had tattooed it with his grandfather’s advice: “Be sensible.” And he had done his best to heed that counsel.

headline.main: Police Shooting Victim in Georgia Tried to Follow ‘Sensible’ Path
headline.print_headline: Shooting Victim Tried to Follow ‘Sensible’ Path
